verses.kjv: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and all his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth of his dominion, and all the people, fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities thereof, saying,
verses.web: The word which came to Jeremiah from LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, with all his army, all the kingdoms of the earth that were under his dominion, and all the peoples, were fighting against Jerusalem and against all its cities, saying:
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Jeremiah while Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon was attacking Jerusalem and all its surrounding cities. Nebuchadnezzar had brought his entire army, along with forces from every kingdom under his control and all their peoples.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel; Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire:
verses.web: “LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Go, and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, LORD says, “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon and he will burn it with fire.
verses.ct: The LORD, the God of Israel, said: "Go speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him that the LORD says, 'I am going to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it to the ground.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt not escape out of his hand, but shalt surely be taken, and delivered into his hand; and thine eyes shall behold the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth, and thou shalt go to Babylon.
verses.web: You won’t escape out of his hand, but will surely be taken and delivered into his hand. Your eyes will see the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he will speak with you mouth to mouth. You will go to Babylon.” ’
verses.ct: You won't escape him. You will be captured and handed over to him. You will stand face to face with the king of Babylon and speak with him in person. Then you will be taken to Babylon.'"

verses.kjv: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O Zedekiah king of Judah; Thus saith the LORD of thee, Thou shalt not die by the sword:
verses.web: “Yet hear LORD’s word, O Zedekiah king of Judah: LORD says concerning you, ‘You won’t die by the sword.
verses.ct: "But listen to the LORD's word, Zedekiah king of Judah. The LORD says this about you: You will not die by the sword.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt die in peace: and with the burnings of thy fathers, the former kings which were before thee, so shall they burn odours for thee; and they will lament thee, saying, Ah lord! for I have pronounced the word, saith the LORD.
verses.web: You will die in peace; and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they will make a burning for you. They will lament you, saying, “Ah Lord!” for I have spoken the word,’ says LORD.”
verses.ct: You will die peacefully. They will burn funeral spices for you, just as they did for the kings who came before you. People will mourn for you, crying out, 'Ah, our lord!' I have spoken this," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Then Jeremiah the prophet spake all these words unto Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
verses.web: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
verses.ct: Jeremiah the prophet delivered all of these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: When the king of Babylon’s army fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish, and against Azekah: for these defenced cities remained of the cities of Judah.
verses.web: when the king of Babylon’s army was fighting against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and against Azekah; for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.
verses.ct: This was while the Babylonian army was attacking Jerusalem and the last remaining fortified cities of Judah — Lachish and Azekah. These were the only walled cities in Judah still standing.

verses.kjv: This is the word that came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people which were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty unto them;
verses.web: The word came to Jeremiah from LORD, after king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them;
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Jeremiah after King Zedekiah made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to set their slaves free.

verses.kjv: That every man should let his manservant, and every man his maidservant, being an Hebrew or an Hebrewess, go free; that none should serve himself of them, to wit, of a Jew his brother.
verses.web: that every man should let his male servant, and every man his female servant, who is a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, go free; that no one should make bondservants of them, of a Jew his brother.
verses.ct: The agreement was that everyone would release their Hebrew slaves — both men and women — so that no one would keep a fellow Jew in slavery any longer.

verses.kjv: Now when all the princes, and all the people, which had entered into the covenant, heard that every one should let his manservant, and every one his maidservant, go free, that none should serve themselves of them any more, then they obeyed, and let them go.
verses.web: All the princes and all the people obeyed who had entered into the covenant, that everyone should let his male servant, and everyone his female servant go free, that no one should make bondservants of them any more. They obeyed and let them go;
verses.ct: All the officials and all the people who had entered into this covenant agreed to it. They freed their male and female slaves and no longer forced them to serve. They obeyed and let them go.

verses.kjv: But afterward they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.
verses.web: but afterwards they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.
verses.ct: But later they changed their minds. They dragged back the men and women they had freed and forced them into slavery again.

verses.kjv: Therefore the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: Therefore LORD’s word came to Jeremiah from LORD, saying,
verses.ct: So the LORD spoke to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel; I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondmen, saying,
verses.web: “LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying,
verses.ct: "The LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I made a covenant with your ancestors on the day I brought them out of Egypt, out of the land where they were slaves. I told them,

verses.kjv: At the end of seven years let ye go every man his brother an Hebrew, which hath been sold unto thee; and when he hath served thee six years, thou shalt let him go free from thee: but your fathers hearkened not unto me, neither inclined their ear.
verses.web: At the end of seven years, every man of you shall release his brother who is a Hebrew, who has been sold to you, and has served you six years. You shall let him go free from you; but your fathers didn’t listen to me, and didn’t incline their ear.
verses.ct: "Every 7 years, each of you must free any fellow Hebrew who has been sold to you. After they have served you for 6 years, you must let them go free." But your ancestors refused to listen to me or pay any attention.

verses.kjv: And ye were now turned, and had done right in my sight, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbour; and ye had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:
verses.web: You had now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in every man proclaiming liberty to his neighbor. You had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name;
verses.ct: Recently, you did what was right in my eyes. Each of you proclaimed freedom for your neighbor, and you made a covenant before me in the house that bears my name.

verses.kjv: But ye turned and polluted my name, and caused every man his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom he had set at liberty at their pleasure, to return, and brought them into subjection, to be unto you for servants and for handmaids.
verses.web: but you turned and profaned my name, and every man caused his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom you had let go free at their pleasure, to return. You brought them into subjection, to be to you for servants and for handmaids.’ ”
verses.ct: But then you turned around and dishonored my name. Each of you took back the slaves you had set free and forced them back into slavery.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Ye have not hearkened unto me, in proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother, and every man to his neighbour: behold, I proclaim a liberty for you, saith the LORD, to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine; and I will make you to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says: “You have not listened to me, to proclaim liberty, every man to his brother, and every man to his neighbor. Behold, I proclaim to you a liberty,” says LORD, “to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine. I will make you be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.ct: So the LORD says: "You refused to obey me by granting freedom to your fellow people. Fine — I will grant you 'freedom,'" declares the LORD, "freedom to be destroyed by the sword, by plague, and by famine. I will make you an object of horror to every kingdom on earth.

verses.kjv: And I will give the men that have transgressed my covenant, which have not performed the words of the covenant which they had made before me, when they cut the calf in twain, and passed between the parts thereof,
verses.web: I will give the men who have transgressed my covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between its parts:
verses.ct: The people who broke my covenant — who failed to keep the terms of the agreement they made before me when they cut a calf in two and walked between its halves —

verses.kjv: The princes of Judah, and the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land, which passed between the parts of the calf;
verses.web: the princes of Judah, the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land, who passed between the parts of the calf;
verses.ct: the officials of Judah, the officials of Jerusalem, the court officers, the priests, and all the common people who walked between the pieces of the calf —

verses.kjv: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies shall be for meat unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the earth.
verses.web: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life. Their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.
verses.ct: I will hand all of them over to their enemies, to those who want them dead. Their corpses will become food for the birds of the sky and the wild animals.

verses.kjv: And Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army, which are gone up from you.
verses.web: “I will give Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their life and into the hands of the king of Babylon’s army, who has gone away from you.
verses.ct: I will also hand Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials over to their enemies, to those who want them dead, and to the Babylonian army — the same army that has just pulled back from you.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will command, saith the LORD, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without an inhabitant.
verses.web: Behold, I will command,” says LORD, “and cause them to return to this city. They will fight against it, take it, and burn it with fire. I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”
verses.ct: I am going to give the order," declares the LORD, "and bring them back to this city. They will attack it, capture it, and burn it with fire. I will turn the cities of Judah into an empty wasteland where no one lives."
